list.name: Changes
list.comment: Refactor settings architecture: encapsulate Listener and Worker settings as nested classes, simplify environment prefix configuration, and adjust worker initialization references.

task.summary: Default task

Add new dependencies: email-validator and python-multipart
Updated `pyproject.toml` to include `email-validator` and `python-multipart` as dependencies. Corresponding packages and metadata have also been added to `pdm.lock`. These changes ensure support for email validation and multipart parsing.

Add assets initialization and favicon to the project
Introduced an `ASSETS_PATH` constant for asset management. Added a `favicon.ico` file to the assets directory to standardize branding and support UI-related features. These changes improve asset organization and enhance project structure.

Fix logger configuration and update SMS server initialization
Added ignored loggers for "asyncio" and "python_multipart.multipart" to the logger configuration to reduce unnecessary log noise. Also adjusted the SMS server initialization by removing the redundant `.serve()` method call.

Update author metadata in package init file
Expanded the author field to include the full company name. This ensures accurate representation of the organization in metadata. No functional changes were introduced.

Refactor SMS sending logic for improved logging clarity.
Simplified the logging flow and adjusted the error handling to separate concerns more cleanly. Warnings and errors are now logged directly within their respective code paths. This change ensures better debugging and maintains consistent logging behavior.

Add API and TCP servers to handle SMS processing
Introduced separate API and TCP servers to manage SMS handling, with shared logic encapsulated in a `BaseServer` class. Updated settings for enhanced configurability, including authentication, allowed networks, and encoding options. Refactored `SMSServer` to integrate the new server implementations and optimize SMS processing.

Update version to 3.1.0 in __init__.py
This change updates the version string to 3.1.0, reflecting new features or updates in the KDS SMS Server. Ensure compatibility and version tracking align with the latest changes.

Refactor server lifecycle methods with `enter` and `exit`
Reorganized server lifecycle management by introducing `enter` and `exit` methods, improving consistency across classes. Replaced server-specific `run` logic with these methods, centralizing setup and teardown behaviors. Updated the API server to use an async lifespan handler for better resource cleanup.

Add log_console_format setting to configure console log format
Introduced a new setting, `log_console_format`, in `settings.py` to allow customization of console log output. This enhances flexibility when defining logging formats for different environments. Minor formatting adjustment in `cli.py` was also made for consistency.

Refactor naming and configuration structure for servers and gateways
Renamed core server and gateway classes for consistency (`SMSServer` → `SmsServer`, `TCPServer` → `TcpServer`, `APIServer` → `ApiServer`, etc.). Updated related configuration class names and settings, introducing better structure (`BaseConfig` → `BaseGatewayConfig`, `AVAILABLE_CONFIGS` → `AVAILABLE_GATEWAY_CONFIGS`, etc.). Adjusted imports and usage throughout the project accordingly. Also added a base server configuration validation class for improved initialization handling.
Rename `tcp_server.py` → `tcp.py` and `api_server.py` → `api.py` with updated imports

Add Field annotations for gateway configuration validation
Enhanced gateway configuration classes (`teltonika.py`, `base.py`, and `vonage.py`) with `pydantic.Field` annotations to provide default values, titles, and descriptions. This improves schema validation, documentation, and usability.

Extract `BaseConfig` for shared configuration logic in servers and gateways
Refactored the configuration structure by extracting a new `BaseConfig` class to centralize shared logic across server and gateway configuration classes. Updated `BaseServerConfig` and `BaseGatewayConfig` to inherit from `BaseConfig`, simplifying code and improving reusability. Adjusted relevant imports and property methods accordingly.

Update dependencies and lockfile for latest versions
Upgraded multiple dependencies, including `typer` (0.16.0), `uvicorn` (0.34.3), and `wiederverwendbar` (0.8.4) with `rich` and `sqlalchemy` extras. Added `greenlet` and `sqlalchemy` packages to support compatibility with updated requirements. Updated `pdm.lock` and `pyproject.toml` accordingly to reflect these changes.

Refactor server and gateway initialization for improved modularity
Streamlined the initialization process for servers and gateways by introducing reusable base classes. Enhanced `SmsServer` to dynamically load configurations and initialize components from `settings`. Adjusted server lifecycle methods to better handle startup and runtime behaviors, improving overall modularity and maintainability. Updated associated imports and configuration structures throughout the project.

Add `db.py` with database models and utility functions
Introduced a new `db.py` module, including the `Db` singleton-based database utility and `Messages` SQLAlchemy model. Added `MessageStatus` enum for message lifecycle states (`queued`, `sent`, `error`). This sets up foundational database support for message management in the KDS SMS server.

Update `settings.py` to integrate `SqlalchemySettings` and enhance field validation
Replaced `UvicornServerSettings` with `SqlalchemySettings` in the `Settings` class for database integration. Added constraints to SMS-related fields (`sms_data_max_size`, `sms_number_max_size`, `sms_message_max_size`) for improved validation. Introduced new logging settings to ignore specific loggers by exact matches or patterns.

Add `logger.py` to initialize and manage logger instances
Introduced a `logger.py` module for centralized logging functionality. Utilized `LoggerSingleton` to handle logger initialization based on module name and settings. This ensures consistent logging configuration across the KDS SMS server.

Refactor `cli.py` to improve command structure and enhance functionality
Revised `cli.py` with clearer command definitions and improved help information. Added new commands: `init-db` for database initialization and updated `serve` and `version` commands for enhanced clarity. Moved logging initialization and server start logic to better align with modularity principles. Adjusted imports and added necessary dependencies for streamlined execution.

Remove legacy server and gateway implementations
Deleted outdated `api.py`, `tcp.py`, `teltonika.py`, and `vonage.py` files to clean up deprecated code. Migrated relevant logic to the new modular structure with updated configurations and gateway/server implementations.
Add IntelliJ IDEA project configuration files for `kds-sms-server`
Add IntelliJ IDEA project configuration files for `kds-sms-server`
Add IntelliJ IDEA project configuration files to support SQLite setup and custom run configurations.
Add IntelliJ IDEA project configuration files to support SQLite setup and custom run configurations.
Add IntelliJ IDEA project configuration files to support SQLite setup and custom run configurations.
Refactor `ApiServer` initialization to improve code readability.
Introduce `UiServer`: add a UI server implementation with configuration, views, and admin interface.
Extend functionality of `UiServer`: implement SMS views and actions, add IP handling, and enhance exception management.
Add HTML templates for `UiServer` and integrate template directory validation.
Refactor `SmsStatusApiModel` and database schema: remove `SmsStatus` enum from API model, adjust column length for `result` and `log`.
Add `PyMySQL` dependency to enable MySQL support.
Add IntelliJ IDEA data source configuration for MySQL
Exclude `.venv` directory from IntelliJ IDEA project structure.
Add detailed and list HTML templates for `UiServer` views.
Refactor settings architecture: separate Listener and Worker-specific configurations, adjust initialization logic, and update references accordingly.
Refactor `UiServer` to replace Starlette with FastAPI, enhance SMS view configuration, and revise route handling.
Refactor settings architecture: encapsulate Listener and Worker settings as nested classes, simplify environment prefix configuration, and adjust worker initialization references.

MESSAGE.value:
Extract `BaseConfig` for shared configuration logic in servers and gateways
Refactored the configuration structure by extracting a new `BaseConfig` class to centralize shared logic across server and gateway configuration classes. Updated `BaseServerConfig` and `BaseGatewayConfig` to inherit from `BaseConfig`, simplifying code and improving reusability. Adjusted relevant imports and property methods accordingly.

Update dependencies and lockfile for latest versions
Upgraded multiple dependencies, including `typer` (0.16.0), `uvicorn` (0.34.3), and `wiederverwendbar` (0.8.4) with `rich` and `sqlalchemy` extras. Added `greenlet` and `sqlalchemy` packages to support compatibility with updated requirements. Updated `pdm.lock` and `pyproject.toml` accordingly to reflect these changes.

Refactor server and gateway initialization for improved modularity
Streamlined the initialization process for servers and gateways by introducing reusable base classes. Enhanced `SmsServer` to dynamically load configurations and initialize components from `settings`. Adjusted server lifecycle methods to better handle startup and runtime behaviors, improving overall modularity and maintainability. Updated associated imports and configuration structures throughout the project.

Add `db.py` with database models and utility functions
Introduced a new `db.py` module, including the `Db` singleton-based database utility and `Messages` SQLAlchemy model. Added `MessageStatus` enum for message lifecycle states (`queued`, `sent`, `error`). This sets up foundational database support for message management in the KDS SMS server.

Add `logger.py` for centralized logging with `LoggerSingleton`
Introduced a `logger.py` module for reusable and centralized logging. Utilizes `LoggerSingleton` from `wiederverwendbar` to manage logger instances, integrating configuration from `settings`. This enhances logging consistency and simplifies logger initialization across the application.

Update `settings.py` to integrate `SqlalchemySettings` and enhance field validation
Replaced `UvicornServerSettings` with `SqlalchemySettings` in the `Settings` class for database integration. Added constraints to SMS-related fields (`sms_data_max_size`, `sms_number_max_size`, `sms_message_max_size`) for improved validation. Introduced new logging settings to ignore specific loggers by exact matches or patterns.

Add `logger.py` to initialize and manage logger instances
Introduced a `logger.py` module for centralized logging functionality. Utilized `LoggerSingleton` to handle logger initialization based on module name and settings. This ensures consistent logging configuration across the KDS SMS server.

Refactor `cli.py` to improve command structure and enhance functionality
Revised `cli.py` with clearer command definitions and improved help information. Added new commands: `init-db` for database initialization and updated `serve` and `version` commands for enhanced clarity. Moved logging initialization and server start logic to better align with modularity principles. Adjusted imports and added necessary dependencies for streamlined execution.

Remove legacy server and gateway implementations
Deleted outdated `api.py`, `tcp.py`, `teltonika.py`, and `vonage.py` files to clean up deprecated code. Migrated relevant logic to the new modular structure with updated configurations and gateway/server implementations.
Introduce admin interface: add `starlette-admin` with SMS management views and actions.

Add IntelliJ IDEA configuration files to project
Introduced `.idea` folder and associated configuration files (`*.iml`, `modules.xml`, `workspace.xml`, etc.) to support IntelliJ-based project setup and management.
Add IntelliJ IDEA project configuration files for `kds-sms-server`
Add IntelliJ IDEA project configuration files to support SQLite setup and custom run configurations.
Refactor `ApiServer` initialization to improve code readability.
Introduce `UiServer`: add a UI server implementation with configuration, views, and admin interface.
Extend functionality of `UiServer`: implement SMS views and actions, add IP handling, and enhance exception management.
Add HTML templates for `UiServer` and integrate template directory validation.
Refactor `SmsStatusApiModel` and database schema: remove `SmsStatus` enum from API model, adjust column length for `result` and `log`.
Add `PyMySQL` dependency to enable MySQL support.
Add IntelliJ IDEA data source configuration for MySQL
Exclude `.venv` directory from IntelliJ IDEA project structure.
Add detailed and list HTML templates for `UiServer` views.
Refactor settings architecture: separate Listener and Worker-specific configurations, adjust initialization logic, and update references accordingly.
Refactor `UiServer` to replace Starlette with FastAPI, enhance SMS view configuration, and revise route handling.
Refactor settings architecture: encapsulate Listener and Worker settings as nested classes, simplify environment prefix configuration, and adjust worker initialization references.
